I think the exception is happening because we have a very slow connection to 
the download site.

What is the update user interface doing ? Is it hanging? does it show an error 
box?

If your network connection is slow, there isn't much we can do to improve it.
What do you expect us do fix?

While downloading, it gives me a message box that an exception has occured.  
Do you want to continue?  I press yes.  And it restarts downloading.  But the 
messagebox reappears. 

What triggers the Socket Timeout exception?

I did notice that connection to eclipse.org is slower than usual (I guess 
people are downloading M9), but I was able to download some features, for 
testing purposes.
The connection time out is exactly that: the handshake protocol between your 
machine and the eclipse server requires some acknowledgement to messages, and, 
likely due to server overload those messages are not received within the 
predefined timeout period.

Update detects this, and tries to re-download from where it left off, but if 
the connection is still bad, it gives up.
I would just try again later.
Closing the bug, as this is an external issue (overloaded server)
